article:
A 'niosome' is a non-ionic surfactant-based liposome. Niosomes are formed mostly
by cholesterol incorporation as an excipient. Other excipients can also be used.
Niosomes have more penetrating capability than the previous preparations of
emulsions. [http://jeepakistan.blogspot.com/2008/05/d.html Your Source of
Information: Niosomes ] They are structurally
similar to liposomes in having a bilayer, however, the materials used to prepare
niosomes make them more stable and thus niosomes offer many more advantages over
liposomes.
